intro: Troximon heterophyllum f. normale, commonly known as the common troximon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, arrow-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
